snippet: And how to get iTunes on a PC play over Bluetooth speakers.

snippet: DUKESS--A. Carleton, 85, died at home in Larchmont, New York, on July 20, 2015 with his adored wife of 60 years, Mona Dukess, and his beloved daughters, Linda, Laura and Karen Dukess, at his side. The most loveable of men, he was treasured by his ...

headline.main: Paid Notice: Memorials  DUKESS, A. CARLETON, 85, DIED AT HOME IN LARCHMONT, NEW YORK, ON JULY 20, 2015 WITH HIS ADORED WIFE OF 60 YEARS, MONA DUKESS, AND HIS BELOVED DAUGHTERS, LINDA, LAURA AND KAREN DUKESS, AT HIS SIDE. THE MOST LOVEABLE OF MEN, HE WAS TREASURED BY HIS SIX GRANDCHILDREN: JOANNA AND SAM BERNSTEIN, BEN AND STEPHEN SCHWED, AND JOSEPH AND JOHNNY LIESMAN, AND WAS A CHERISHED FATHER, IN, LAW TO JODY DIPERNA, ROGER SCHWED AND STEVE LIESMAN. HE LOVED HIS NIECES AND NEPHEWS, REJOICED IN HIS FRIENDSHIPS WITH PEOPLE YOUNG AND OLD, AND WAS KNOWN AS A GREAT RACONTEUR AND A WISE LISTENER. CARLETON WAS PRE, DECEASED BY HIS OLDER BROTHER, JOSEPH DUKESS. A GRADUATE OF SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY AND COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF LAW, CARLETON HAD A DISTINGUISHED CAREER AS A REAL ESTATE ATTORNEY AND DEVELOPER. HE DRAFTED THE DOCUMENTATION FOR THE NATION'S FIRST CONDOMINIUM DEVELOPMENT AND LECTURED EXTENSIVELY ON THE THEN, NOVEL FORM OF OWNERSHIP. HIS INTEREST IN THE RESTORATION OF URBAN BUILDINGS FOR LOW AND MODERATE INCOME HOUSING LED TO HIS CO, FOUNDING OF CONTINENTAL WINGATE COMPANY, INC., A HOUSING AND REHABILITATION COMPANY. HE WAS A PRESIDENT OF THE NATIONAL HOUSING AND REHABILITATION ASSOCIATION AND SERVED ON THE CITIZENS HOUSING & PLANNING COUNCIL OF NEW YORK. HE LATER WAS A PARTNER IN CASTLE PROPERTIES CO. AND A DIRECTOR OF APPLE BANK FOR SAVINGS IN NEW YORK. APPRECIATIVE OF HIS GOOD FORTUNE, CARLETON DEVOTED SIGNIFICANT TIME AND ATTENTION TO CHARITABLE ENDEAVORS. HE WAS A TRUSTEE OF BARNARD COLLEGE, AND A MEMBER OF THE BOARDS OF THE NEW YORK FOUNDATION, COMMUNITY RESOURCE EXCHANGE, CASTLE HILL CENTER FOR THE ARTS AND THE PROVINCETOWN ART ASSOCIATION AND MUSEUM. CARLETON LOVED ITALIAN OPERA, THE MUSIC OF BENNY GOODMAN, FISHING, BOATING, SINGLE, MALT SCOTCH AND READING, BUT LOVED NOTHING MORE THAN SPENDING TIME WITH HIS FRIENDS AND FAMILY, ESPECIALLY IN HIS FAVORITE PLACE, HIS HOME IN TRURO, MASSACHUSETTS. A MEMORIAL SERVICE WAS HELD AT 11AM ON FRIDAY, JULY 24 AT JOHN J. FOX FUNERAL HOME IN LARCHMONT, NEW YORK. IN LIEU OF FLOWERS, THE FAMILY REQUESTS DONATIONS TO CANCER SUPPORT TEAM OF PURCHASE, NEW YORK, OR THE PROVINCETOWN ART ASSOCIATION AND MUSEUM. 1

snippet: These siblings, best known as two-thirds of the bluegrass band Nickel Creek, are releasing a record with a heavyweight supporting cast.

headline.main: Sean and Sara Watkins Celebrate a Debut Album, ‘Watkins Family Hour’

snippet: Even as crises have swirled around the world, major American stock indexes have moved little this year.
abstract: Jeff Sommer Strategies column notes that American stock market has remained relatively calm in 2015, despite unfolding of global economic crises and drop in American corporate earnings; states there is reasonable chance for profit for buy-and-hold investors.

headline.main: U.S. Markets Are an Oasis for Buy-and-Hold Investors

snippet: Catch up on the top stories and get a head start on what’s to come.

byline.original: By MICHAEL OWEN and SANDRA STEVENSON

snippet: Devices that monitor vital signs and remind people to take medicine can help older people stay in their homes longer and more cheaply.
abstract: Retiring column examines range of technologies and devices aimed at helping the elderly stay in their own homes and communities safely, in better health and at lower cost in comparison to residential care facilities.

headline.main: Technology, While Not a Fountain of Youth, Can Make Aging Safer
headline.print_headline: Aging Gracefully, or at Least More Safely, With Tech Help

snippet: From go-karts to IndyCar to Formula One, Gil de Ferran has done it all.

headline.main: A Racing Life, on Track and Off
headline.print_headline: A Racing Life, on Track and Off

snippet: Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac discuss the week’s tech news. This week: After Uber defeated New York’s effort to cap its growth, how might other cities address Uber and companies like it?
abstract: Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac discuss the week’s tech news. This week: After Uber defeated New York’s effort to cap its growth, how might other cities address Uber and companies like it?
